revised_title: The Impact of Excess Vitamin A on Differentiated Embryonic Chicken Skin
tldr: This study investigates the effect of excess vitamin A on cultures of embryonic chicken skin explanted at different stages of differentiation. The results show that excess vitamin A induces mucous metaplasia in the epidermis, leading to the formation of a mucin-secreting membrane. This transformation is reversible when the explants are transferred to normal medium. The findings provide insights into the role of vitamin A in tissue development and differentiation.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
